name: Gotham City Impostors Free to Play
description: Gotham City Impostors is now Free to Play! Join the Batman "helpers" or junior Jokerz in the streets of Gotham full of bullets, bodies, and bear traps.
minimum_requirements: Minimum OS: Windows XP SP3                 Processor: Dual Core CPU 2.5 GHz                 Memory: 1.5 GB RAM                 Hard Disk Space: 7 GB Hard Drive Space                 Video Card: 256MB dedicated memory DX9 Video Card (GeForce 8600 or ATI X1800 or better)                 DirectX®: DX9                 Sound: DX9 compatible Sound Controller                 Additional: Broadband Internet Connection
recommended_requirements: Recommended OS: Windows 7                 Processor: Quad Core CPU 2 GHz                 Memory: 2 GB RAM                 Hard Disk Space: 7 GB Hard Drive Space                                 Video Card: 512MB DX9 High-Performance Video Card (GeForce 8800 or ATI X1900 or better)                  DirectX®: DX9                 Sound: DX9 compatible Sound Controller                 Additional: Broadband Internet Connection

I said I needed to finish, as I didn't want to loose, and he said: 'Why so serious?' Play this game...its amazing. I dont play TF2 or really even like TF2. It kind of resembles that a little bit but its so much better. People complain about this and that but if you like a fast paced shooter with customization and some hilarious characters youll like this. Ok...let me explain what this game is like...Its like a group of over weight, poor kids got together one summer day and decided to start a fight club loosely based on batman. They never really saw any of the batman cartoons but they heard of him from kids at school. So they all decided to gather at whoevers house had the biggest back yard. One kid brings along his brothers new ski googles and a stick he found in his back yard that sort of looked like a gun. Another kid found some oven mitts and a hard hat in his parents basement so he brought those. The only skinny kid in the group brings his dads welding mask and the hockey stick his dad uses to unclog the kitchen sink. Another brings a weed wacker with no gas in it. Another dresses up in foot ball pads and brings along his pellet gun. So there they are. All standing around in the hot sun wondering what to do next. The fattest kid starts yelling out some random rules of combat he thought up that morning on the toilet....and they go to it. Its pure insanity. That fat kid...who made up all the rules that first day...he became a video game designer. And that my friends is Gotham City Impostors.

I actually learned about this game from my Father. He had played it on the Xbox 360 and I hadn't ever seen him play before. A bit of people started to say it was really bad, but once I got into it I enjoyed the game. It -does- lag a few times for me which doesn't matter much as it only lasts about maybe a half second at most. Others have said they've gotten massive lag spikes, but I assume that might have been because of their internet. The game is wacky and silly which is why I love it. The customizations are amazing, but the guns -can- be a bit undefeatable if you had just started the game and don't know how to get around them. I do not recommend this for people who come into it and expect for it to be like Call of Duty, because it is not. There are crazy different gadgets that add into the games. They can be unpredictable and deadly as ever or totally predictable and harmless depending on the person on the other end. Overall I do recommend this game for anyone who likes to giggle at their game and customize their character with just pure craziness.

Gotham City Impostors is a fun, silly FPS about about a ton of batman stalkers who are obsessed enough to dress up like Batman, buy guns and try to abolish an entire other team of of people who are obsessed with The Joker and are trying to destroy The Batman stalkers. The teams are called 'The Batz' and 'The Jokerz'. You have a huge selections loadouts, guns and even characters, When you go into a game you have a selection of loadouts, the options of loadouts change everyday, So you might like the paladin loadout, It might dissapear the next day. I forgot to mention all of the loadouts have names like Trapper and Paladin, But you always have your custom loadouts, But before we get to that lets talk about the characters, Now there are alot of characters or 'Impostors', the only thing that sets them apart is much they weigh and whether they are a boy or a girl, Some are very fat and some are very thin, The skinny ones go faster than the more obese, Thats really it with the impostors. Customs Loadouts are a concern of mine, see this game is Free to Play but you need to buy special DLC in order to have any of the weapons, You will eventually get 'Unlock Tickets' but really, It feels like I am playing a demo of the game, I mean its fun trying the daily loadouts provided but if you want to stick to one playstyle you have to pay, This is kind of a Pay to Win game, The only reason I think this is Free to Play is because players are attracted to F2Ps or the fact that they were extra successful, I mean games like Dota 2 and Team Fortress 2 were huge and if they costed money they wouldn't be that big. So technically this costs money for the full game but you can play a free version with not as much content. There is no competitive I am aware of but there are many moments where you can yell 'MLG!!!' there is no campaign but I no one really cares. I can't really use this to judge against the game but its crude, its only to fit the attitude of the game but whenever the batz win the game it says 'who's laughing now ***clowns!?' and the catch phrases are edgy as well but as I said I can't use that to judge against the game. If you have a crap computer like me you'll get 20-40 FPS so it runs mediocre on bad computers, the graphics are cartoonish but right on!, The maps have an interesting atmosphere that I have never seen in any other game I've played, The people look interesting as well their character designs show how obsessed they really are, their not the most relatable folks but gameplay makes up for it, I love the games Icon or Logo its a cartoon batman but it looks actually hand-drawn, He appears on the menu, loading screen, lobby screen etc. The game is Very fun, it kinda has a strange senstitivity though I cant describe it but you'll know it when you play the game, There is a common bug were you start out with no keybinds, What the heck?. Some of the keybinds are confusing and uninmportant. If you ever accidentally rebind 'look right' to left click you might rebind it and move your mouse right and it will say 'Mouse Axis X is already set to look up, do you want to set it to look to look right?' despite that you can press 2 and everything will be set default but you will have to reset custom keybinds. Anyways Gotham City Impostors is a fun game with a good style, despite its pay to win style 8/10

OK so I've been playing for the last couple of few hours and here's my verdict.  Fun game! Surprisingly polished for a free to play game (although to be fair it wasn't F2P at launch)  Reminds me of a cross between TF2, and Blacklight Retribution with a bit of Batman: Arkham City thrown in the mix. :)  Good graphics, good lighting , particle FX and shadows.  Plenty of options to allow low end systems to run the game nicely or to give decent hardware some extra eye-candy.  Sound is more than adequate with some great character taunts and stuff. Music is very appropriate to the setting and not annoying at all.  Usual MP game-modes with some twists.  It doesn't actually feel like a pay-to-win game to me so far. Play to unlock seems to be working fine for me ...   You can start group games with people on your Steam friends list or join through standard matchmaking.  All in all; it's been worth every penny I've spent on it so far. ;)  Oh yeah , and there are loads of Steam achievements...

A well put together free-to-play FPS. The formula is very similar to CoD: get xp for kills, assists, etc, level up, then unlock new weapons, mods and perks. The twist is the batman theme makes everything a lot more lighthearted than CoD. With gadgets like rollerskates and grappling hooks, the game can be very frantic, but a lot of fun. I also found it pretty easy to play without spending any money, as you get a good number of unlocks pretty quickly.

Fun times to be had with GCI. If you like FPS that have a something little extra in them, or non realisitc like Call of Duty, but more so fun, this is the game for you. However, as good as a game it is, it's not what it use to be. Hardly anyone plays anymore, and I can't seem to find out why, everyone who plays it loves it, so why are the lobby's empty. Of the 4 game modes, only deathmatch is played these days, no answer for that either. The dying out of it's fanbase is the only flaw in this game. It is very even when it comes to play type, every loadout has a counter measure to it, so there's never a way of purely overpowering your opponent. If you lose, it's your fault, not the game.

It’s every child’s dream, to be a superhero (or a princess), and everyone knows the most awesome superhero was Batman (he’s not a princess). Unless the child is a bit odd, then they wanted to be a Supervillian; just like the Joker (also not a princess, no matter what he says)! That dream never leaves you, maybe it gets a bit tarnished by the real world, but it’s still there at the back of your mind; the urge to fight crime while dressed like a maniac!  Gotham city Impostors is what happens when grown men and women give in to that urge; (no not the one about dressing as a princess) dressing as Heroes with costumes inspired by Batman and Villains with costumes inspired by the Joker and go to war in the streets, amusement parks and industrial building of Gotham city!  Using weapons and gadgets inspired by both the ones Batman uses and the Joker’s sense of humour; it all ends up just as twisted as it sounds: jack in the box bombs, home made gliders and even home-made rocket launchers shooting out bottle rockets!  There’s quite a few costume pieces that can be unlocked in the game (or if you really are crazy: Bought with Microsoft points), allowing you to dress your character up like crazed hobo versions of Batman and the Joker!  You can even wear nothing but a mask, cape, underwear and rollerskates!  A very fun game, with the ability to find a play style that should suit anyone!

Gotham City Impostors is a free awesome multiplayer FPS shooter. The gameplay is highly enjoyable and there's tons of replay value. There is a lot of customisation in the game - Secret Identity is about a lot more than just the load-outs! The maps are all great to play on which is a rare find in an FPS. Occasionally servers will drop but this is what you expect with peer-to-peer server hosting. If you're looking for an FPS which is just straight-up fun, this is it! If you ever find yourself low on liquid assets, but are getting tired of your library of games on Steam, and want to ask me for a good free title to pick up: Gotham City Impostors would probably be in the top 3 I would reccomend.    The idea seemed weird, a PvP shooter that takes place in Gotham City but almost little to nothing to do with Batman or the crass menagerie of Gotham's villains - but I think that makes it work. Instead of being 'superheroes vs. supervillains', you take the role of one of Gotham's more latently psychotic citizens and you fight others like you in small arenas with a surprisingly diverse array of weaponry and gadgets.    But that's also a downside. The game uses a system where you are awarded in-game credits for matches you take part in, and you get bonuses for various events such as winning. You can use these credits to buy more weapons and gadgets. Which is standard for many F2P shooters, but also standard to the F2P shooter is the inevitability of being in a match against somebody that has a jetpack while all you have are roller blades. True, the two can't really be compared since they are two different pieces of equipment with different functions - but none of that seems to matter after you get Superman-punched for the 20th time.    Frustrating? Yes. But it's also strangely motivating, after eating pavement for the xth time, it was only then I noticed I had been playing much longer than I had intended and was feeling engrossed in the entire experience of the game. Even when you get killed, the player who killed you utters one of several pre-determined lines of dialouge that range from snarky to snarky but kinda charming.    I haven't played the game that long, so I don't have much more to say about it - aside from that is IS an experience. Its unique, fun, and interesting. Definitely worth a try.

It's good mindless fun. Gameplay is chaotic and the maps do promote that chaos, more or less. I would say that the maps could offer far more crazyness in their design but they're good enough. The game offers a bit of verticality, in that you can glide and use your grappling hook to attach to buildings and what not in order to give you momentum in the air which is part of the fun of the combat.    The weapons are generic though. Some are fun to use but they're nothing you haven't seen before, in one way or another. It's just riffles, swords and bombs, most of them don't even look different like in Bioshock, they do look like generic riffles. Sometimes I felt I was playing the first Resistence game. Don't get me wrong, blasting and slicing is fun in any way, shape or form, but like I said, for a game that embraces crazyness, it's not crazy enough in some basic regards.   You can costumize your character for the different factions, being it the Bats or the Jokerz. It's somewhat limited, however the items (such as masks and bat-symbols) are so much fun and over the top that I didn't care.   That being said, if you are a Batman fan like myself (...which you can probably tell right away), you won't find much of 'Batman' in this. The Jokerz play like Joker's regular goons but the Bats are copycats of Batman... with guns. So they do play the same which is a missed opportunity in my opinion. The characters may look like they fit in the Batman world but that's about it. The gameplay does nothing new and you could pretty much insert any other characters in the game and the result would be the same. The novelty runs fast on this one.   However, I still recomend the game. It's free. And it's fun. You should definitely try the game, who knows, you may actually enjoy it. It's just too generic for its own good, which is a shame, but there's still fun to be had and it plays like a mix of Team Fortress with Quake. Only not as good as that sounds.   Do try it. You may enjoy it more than I have.

Extremely fun game. It's a cartoony, fast-moving fps with some interesting weapons and gear. Unforuntately not too many people still play, and the developer/publisher has long since pretty much abandoned this title, so don't expect any improvements to the current state. But the current state is good for a good several hours of enjoyment.   It's not perfect, my biggest problems with it are the occasional random freeze-ups and a couple instances of server lag and server connection loss. The lag and connection loss have been fairly uncommon in my experience thus far, but since it's a peer-hosted game, this will of course depend on the host that you happen to have. The freeze-ups seem to happen at least once or twice per match. I've seen a theory that they happen when someone enters/leaves the game.   Also some people may not like the fact that all of the content is heavily gated. The unlocks do come fairly fast, but weapon unlocks seem kinda rare in particular. However the great thing about it is that when you get an unlock key for something (weapon, gadget, body type, passive, etc) you can look through the whole list of items available and unlock any one thing of your choice without any sort of level requirements.   Some of the real cash purchases are kinda pricy imo, larger packs like the 'impostor kits' in particular, but I'd say the f2p model is pretty fair because you don't really need to spend money to compete, provided you learn the game and play well (and get a few level ups and unlocks).   My one somewhat-major gripe with this system is that the loadout slots seem to only be available through those pricy impostor kits i mentioned, which apparently limits free players to only the original 2 custom loadout slots (plus the handful of random loadout the game offers on rotation). I'd at least like to see the loadout slots be available for purchase individually and inexpensively. And maybe it wouldn't kill them to give you one free slot as you level up (I've yet to get one at lvl 42). (Yet to get one at whatever level I am now which is like 80something. So by now I'm pretty sure you never do get that third loadout slot for free).  Another somewhat-major gripe I have with the game in general is that they did that really annoying thing where they decided to make microphones always-on by default and there's no option anywhere to disable them. This is often not a problem at all..unless you get that annoying 12 year old screaming into his microphone. Unfortunately muting someone is also pretty clunky, from in-game you have to hit esc to bring up the menu, go to the players tab, and find the person you want to mute and click 2 as you hover over them.. So usually it's wiser to just mute everyone in one go.   And another problem is the match-making system. It doesn't necessarily always work right, and you might end up standing in a lobby by yourself waiting for other people while another lobby fills up. Exiting the queue and entering again sometimes fixes this. Though some times it just does seem impossible to get a match started, due to a combination of bad match-making and/or just not having enough players around.  Though there are threads on the forums on how to change your region if there are no players at a certain time, basically you go to your steam options and change your download region and restart the game. This has had success for me, but naturally if you change your region to halfway across the world your ping will most likely not be exactly perfect.   But the game really is damned fun, so I've been more than willing to put up with the flaws I've encountered.   To be honest, I'm edititing this review after going back to the game after a while of absense, and lately I've not enjoyed it quite as much as I did earlier. But I did get something like 70 hours out of this game, so yeah, I still highly recommend trying it. And it's free to play so it's not like you really risk anything.

Oh man! I've been playing this game for quite some time now. You see, back in the day, I was a Team Fortess 2 player and I loved that game. I quit for awhile and I decided to give this game a try that was recommended by a friend. I must say, this game is great! It is extremely fun and a great way to pass time. I tend to get more enjoyment from this game than I ever do in TF2, not trying to bash TF2 at all. TF2 is a great game too! The community is vanishing though, so it needs all the players it can get! I have to admit that there are some problems with matchmaking, and the fact that you can only get into team deathmatch now these days. Since there are no dedicated servers, players are chosen at random and they host the game. From time to time you get a terrible host, and the game lags out a lot, making it near impossible to play. When you get around the bad things, and get good hosts and people with decent loadouts, this game can be really fun! If it weren't for the constant problems, I would give this game a whopping 10/10. Sadly, due to these problems I am going to give this game a 9/10, which isn't much of a big difference from 10. This game is just that good!

This game is a fairly fun game to play if you are run ragged from serious shooters like Call of Duty and Battlefield, but don't want to play Team Fortress 2. While the community is very few, a few of the right people spreading the right word could bring this game back.   It plays like a slightly watered-down Team Fortress 2 with more maneuver options and weapon attachments. You are a poorly-costumed copycat of either the caped crusader, Batman, or his psychopathic arch-enemy, Joker. You join into combat with other poorly-costumed copycats against another team of poorly-costumed copycats and the best team of poorly-costumed copycats wins.  The Good: -The Customization: You are able to customize how your bat-fake or Joke-killer look with various logos, outfits, and what have you. -The Payment: The use of money in this game is almost purely cosmetic as you can unlock the same stuff with the proper amount of grind. -The Maneuverablity: It is really easy to get around the map and get to high points and other advantages. It is also very creative in it's methods. Example: One of my most diffcult choices in the game, mode of transport: Skates or Hangglider?  The Bad: -The Gunplay: Every weapon does roughly the same damage, barring any attachments added. It eventually goes down to, what I like to call, 'rock, paper, scissors' gameplay, -The Lack of ID: In game, it can get pretty difficult to identify if the person you are shooting at is on your side or not at times.

GC Impostors is a multiplayer shooter developed by Monolith and became free-to-play after a year.  Pros: There are not many levels, but those are well-designed, which is also true when it comes to the characters and weapons. Overally interesting and unique ideas in gameplay. Different gadgets and addons let you play in your own style. Good character progression with plenty to unlock and purchase, even on the 500th level. Visual customization options are nice, you can have your very own look on both sides. Challenges, achievements and feats are expanding the content range. Good humour and theme. I got a lot of packs after my purchase of the original.  Cons: Terrible lag, performance, server, and other issues making almost impossible to play the game. I cannot play the game even on the lowest settings. Worst game of all time optimization wise. Matchmaking is the same as before, so you might get onto a server where 80% of the players have bad ping. Also, there are server connection losses and other stuff to entertain you if you bored. Only a few game modes and a handful of maps. Some overpowered weapons and gear. With packs purchased through steam better equipment can be obtained early. Content which can only be unlocked via purchase. No actual expansions, maps, weapons, anything added for years. Not many players nowadays.  Overall, after more than 2 years of my purchase I still cannot play the game smoothly. The performance only slightly improved. It is a shame that good ideas were ruined by incompetent optimization.   OVERALL: 7.0/10 (FAIR)  Graphics: 8/10 World Design: 9/10 Gameplay: 9/10 Sound: 8/10 Replay Value: 7/10 Performance: 4/10

Will try to make this short  The game: GCI is a team-based shooter just like others you've seen, It features a decent amount of game modes and customization (clothes, weapons, profile, etc.) and works on the basis that on particular levels you can unlock something. It's kind-of like TF2 but with no set classes, and Batman V Joker based (don't play this if you hate either, as you'll be forced to play as them half of the time). Tutorial teaches you some of basics, but proves insuficient once you start the real thing (it's mostly 'stand and do this).   Pros: + Fun, fast paced, game + Good Customization Options + Stupid enough to make you smile + Decent amount of game modes (around 5) + Doesn't seem Pay2Win, but you really have to know what you're doing with your first unlocks (or save them). + Good balance of weapons, however as I mentioned you will need to level if you want access to any non-starting weapon. + Cool movies, but weird ones, what did you expect?  Cons: - Only one game mode is playable (Team Deathmatch), seriously, I queued every other game mode 3-5 times with no success. - Matchmaking doesn't exist, first online game (level 1), level 120 or so on the other, not even kidding (there's no stat boost or anything, but he has access to a lot of equipment and has a lot of exp that a new player just doesn't). My side had a level 90, rest of us were 1-8. - Both things might be because of this, but not many people play this. (Dead game). - You can only play as Batman or Joker. No Robin, No Catwoman, No Riddler (I'd love to play as Riddler, so it was a huge letdown) or any character you'd like to play as. - Only 6 maps. Yup, that's right, 6. Each of the game modes can be played on any map as far as I know though. - You can't change video options in-game, so you won't know if the configuration you picked runs smoothly until it's too late.  The opinion: As a light game or mod, this could be great, however as a full-blown game, with barely enough players that only allow for the simplest game mode, not worth the disk space. Don't get me wrong, it's fun, will keep you really entertained for a while, but you'll get bored sooner than later.  The rest: If you want something stupid, go find another fun multiplayer game. If you want something FPS team-based, go find another game. This game has a correct balance between both, but doesn't excell in any for it to be truly destacable. Nothing sticks out really, it's just a mixture of everything we've seen in MMOFPS., nothing original (apart from the funny disguises).   Recommendations: * More promotion, no players kills this game instantly. * More maps. * More disguisable characters, only 2 makes it boring. (Just change the name to order v chaos or something). * Joker small part of the tutorial (maybe in-field to help you get the hang of it?) * Altough it has a great start, still needs a little 'unique' thing for it to be a game on its own and not just 'the same game, but stupid and with batman' * Maybe in-game option change? That only screws you the first couple times you play, but could potentially screw you up a lot... * Rest is really good.

Not worth the effort. In the very short time that I've been playing, I've been DC'd 7 times and forcable had my steam disconnected fron GCI 3 times. Game balance is also crap. I've been getting my ♥♥♥ handed to me by pay-to-win and troll farmers every match. Right off the bat, I got placed on a team against two level 1,000 egofarmers and it hasn't let up all day. The community seems pretty damn small, judging by the time it takes to round up the minimum players for a deathmatch. The is no auto-detect for optimal setting, so the learning curve is hampered by needing to tweek settings and then try those. Lag is terrible and compounding the lag issue is the impact stun/stutter. So you freeze due to lag, then your toon is locked in place by weapons fire, you die, the game can barely handle all this and you're still moving in slow-mo (if at all) when you respawn.  Skip it. Go play minecraft. Just like every other Server-FPS, this game is completely dominated by a very few players and not worth venturing into for people without monsterous gaming rigs or those ♥♥♥♥-poor ♥♥♥♥♥ people that farm profiles for cash.

I used to like this game on the Xbox... And I really wanted to like it here on the PC as well. But since WB abandoned the game, you can no longer verify your email for the WBID to get your bonuses. All anyone seems to play anymore is Team Deathmatch, which I really don't mind and it's one of my favorite game modes across many games... But with the constant kicks and disconnects from the servers every 3-5 minutes, and having tried every possible solution I can... Makes it a total waste of time to try and play. While the game was once awesome and a very good idea... It's not worth trying to play on the PC now. So I would not recommend it at all.
